Cha-Rie Tang

Exhibition: Cha-Rie Tang: 48 Years of Artistic Innovation in Pasadena

October 4, 2025 - February 22, 2026
Cha-Rie Tang, founder of Pasadena Craftsman Tile and an acclaimed multidisciplinary artist and architect, reflects on her creative journey in a retrospective exhibition

MORE INFO
Stories, Traditions & Designs

Exhibition: Stories, Traditions & Designs: Spotlighting the African American Quilters of Los Angeles

October 4, 2025 - February 22, 2026
This exhibition features members of the African American Quilters of Los Angeles (AAQLA) selecting from among their own creations for a display that expresses their history, creativity, and shared experiences

Fnyes Mansion Tours

With its original furnishings and art collection, the Fnyes Mansion is an elegant and charming cultural landmark that majestically stands on Pasadena's historic Millionaire's row.

Research Library & Archives

We maintain the areas largest and most comprehensive collection of documents and artifacts related to the history of Pasadena and the west San Gabriel valley.

MORE INFO
FROZEN FRAMES
ONLINE ACTIVITIES

Frozen Frames: Preserving Pasadenas Visual Legacy

ONGOING VIRTUAL EXHIBITION
An exhibit series in four parts, bringing artistically and historically compelling images out of the deep freeze and into public view. The photographs come from among the more than 200,000 at-risk negatives that are now cryogenically preserved as part of the Museums Great History Freeze project of 2015.

MORE INFO

EXHIBITIONS

Our exhibitions feature diverse topics that speak to the area’s multi-faceted history and interests.
IN THE GALLERIES NOW

In the Galleries

February 28 – September 14, 2025


100 YEARS – 100 IMAGES

A retrospective in collaboration with the Pasadena Society of Artists (PSA) featuring pivotal historic pieces honoring PSA members across the decades, as well as a juried display of artwork by present-day PSA members.

More Information

Events & Programs

Public programming has always been at the core of the Museums mission and outreach. Tours, lectures, and presentations are designed to offer a wide selection of engaging, history-based, age-appropriate content and collective experiences to all sectors of our large and diverse community.

February 12, 2026

Be Careful, Its My Heart! | A Valentines-Themed Clip Show

Pasadena Museum of History - 7:00 pm - 8:30 pm

General Admission: $18 | PMH Members: $13
Film historian and musicologist Galen Wilkes will take us on a Valentines-themed journey into the imaginary love lives of many delicious tinsel-town twosomes spanning movies from the 1890s to the 1950s. Join us for an evening of nostalgia, love and laughter!
February 14, 2026

Romance Along the Arroyo - A Valentines Day Event

Pasadena Museum of History - 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm

General Admission: $35 | PMH & Gamble House Members: $30
Join Pasadena Museum of History & The Gamble House and celebrate Valentines Day in vintage style. Enjoy an evening of romantic music, sparkling toasts, sweet and savory treats, and an abundance of architectural and decorative delights in two historic homes.
February 19, 2026

Curators Tour | Cha-Rie Tang: 48 Years of Artistic Innovation in Pasadena

Pasadena Museum of History - 11:00 am - 12:00 pm

General Admission: $18 | PMH Members: $13
ExploreCha-Rie Tang: 48 Years of Artistic Innovation in Pasadenawith curator Cha-Rie Tang. Learn more about the exhibitions featured works, including vibrant fused glass pieces, high-relief ceramic tiles, and framed designs and sketches.
March 26, 2026

Altadena: Between Wilderness and City with Michele Zack

Pasadena Museum of History - 7:00 pm - 8:30 pm

General Admission: $18 | PMH Members: $13
Join author and historian Michele Zack for a lively discussion about the re-issue of her book Altadena: Between Wilderness and City.
view all upcoming events

Research Library & Archives

The Pasadena Museum of History maintains the areas largest and most comprehensive collection of documents and artifacts related to the history of Pasadena and the west San Gabriel valley. The ever-expanding collection spans the years 1834 to the present and contains well over 1,000,000 historic photographs, rare books, manuscripts, maps, architectural records, and more.

More About the Research Library & Archives
